problems.title: Combination Sum
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given an array of distinct integers candidates and a target integer target, return a list of all unique combinations of candidates where the chosen numbers sum to target.

The same number may be chosen from candidates an unlimited number of times.

Backtracking Approach:
At each step, choose a candidate. If sum < target, recurse (allowing same candidate again).

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:

        # TODO: Find combinations summing to target
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    data = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    n, target = map(int, data[0].split())
    candidates = list(map(int, data[1].split()))
    sol = Solution()
    result = sol.combinationSum(candidates, target)
    result = [sorted(c) for c in result]
    result.sort()
    print(' '.join([','.join(map(str, c)) for c in result]))

hintsList: Pass 'start' index to recursion to avoid duplicates (since we can reuse same element).
